channel.title: Icy on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in Icy on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: How to withdraw ICY
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: A. Set up: Create an on-chain crypto wallet Install the extension on your browser Go to https://metamask.io/download/ and Click ‚ÄúInstall Metamask for Chromium‚Äù Add the wallet extension to the Chrome on Firefox Browser (DO NOT use Safari) Follow guideline to create a wallet Click to the Metamask Icon to use the wallet For those who haven‚Äôt had any wallet, please click ‚ÄúCreate a new wallet‚Äù Enter the password for the wallet Read the instruction of Wallet security and Choose ‚ÄúSecure my wallet‚Äù Reveal and copy the seed phrase, the save it at a safe place.

item.title: What's New in February 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Reporting tech signals - Latest findings on Serverless Computing, AI & ML, FinOps and CyberSecurity Research Topics 2024 - 40 topics on the most promising technologies. Dwarves’ Reward System - Developing our community reward system Calling for Partners - One of the rare event where Dwarves and community members gather. Reporting tech signals Every month we watch tech trends closely to depict which ones have high potential, and can be part of our growing tech stack.

item.title: $icy in 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Follow up on our recent post df protocol, $icy and $dfg. Since 2020, $icy has been a part of our workflow. Here’s a quick recap. 2020: we introduced ICY as our first community experiment. 2021: we launched icy.so, a site to redeem $icy. 2022: $icy became our primary reward method, starting with summit-2022 and doty where we sent out about $20000 2023: we introduced vault as a reward avenue for our functional team.

item.title: üí† df protocol, $icy and $dfg
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Here’s our draft internal map/v0 for üßä $icy play, based on our current activities at this borderless software firm. Context: Back in 2018, when i envisioned doing something unconventional with our setup, we introduced üíé $dfg. It came with a dream that everyone on the team can help build next generation software, stay cool making money and own something. I planned to step down and give more ownership to those who actually implement our projects by gradually distributing $dfg to our grind chads.
